value.title: Power BI Icon Names for Conditional Formatting Using DAX
value.excerpt: I have previously written about conditional formatting in Power BI, and how you can take one step further with using DAX to dynamically change the conditional formatting. Conditional formatting with DAX for colors is easy, you can use the color name or their hex code. But for Icons, it is slightly different.

value.title: Power BI Is Too Much for One Person   Roles in the Power BI Development
value.excerpt: Power BI is a tool that you can get started working with it in a few hours, but to use it in its full potential, these days, you require to have many skills. The variety of solutions and BI implementations is also dictating to have different roles, positions, jobs in the Power BI development market.

value.title: Power BI Quick Tip: the Formula Bar in Power Query
value.excerpt: Often you do the transformation in Power Query using the graphical interface, but having the formula bar visible, makes it much easier to understand or change the transformations. value.title: Power BI Subscription   Get Report Updates In Email
value.excerpt: Have you ever wondered is it possible to have updates of the Power BI report to be emailed to you (or some other colleagues) on a daily basis? Power BI, fortunately, has this feature, it is called Subscription. Subscriptions are helpful ways to send an up-to-date version of the report and dashboard to

value.title: Power BI Theme   Customize Colors Fonts and Visual Appearance for Multiple Objects
value.excerpt: If you build a report for an enterprise, you might be limited to use the organization-approved colors. It is also useful to have your reports following a template of colors, and fonts, which might look like your signature of the report. In Power BI, you can do that with Theme. value.title: What is Premium Per User License for Power BI, and What is it good for
value.excerpt: One of the great news in Microsoft Ignite 2020 is the announcement of a new licensing plan for Microsoft Power BI, called Premium Per User, or Premium Gen2. In this article, I'll explain what that is, and how this can be helpful for Power BI users. Read my article here to find links to study more: https://radacad.com/what-is-premium-per-user-license-for-power-bi-and-what-is-it-good-for

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Applying color banding by document number in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use conditional formatting with a DAX expression to color the rows of a table in Power BI based on the order number instead of using the alternate rows color formatting option. Article and download: https://sql.bi/661744?aff=yt

value.title: Using ALLSELECTED in composite models

value.title: 5 New Features I Love – Coming Soon to Power BI
